thread.title: Fight night in Birmingham on Sky Sports - LIVE
thread.title_full: Fight night in Birmingham on Sky Sports - LIVE

title: Fight night in Birmingham on Sky Sports - LIVE
text:
Tweet 
A stacked card presented by Matchroom Boxing, live on Sky Sports, will be topped by Stourbridge's Sam Eggington and his first title defence. 
‘The Savage’ puts up his British and Commonwealth welterweight belts against nemesis Dale Evans, who replaced the injured Frankie Gavin at 10 days notice. 
The incentive now is one step towards the Lonsdale belt and silencing Welshman Evans, one of only two to hand him a pro defeat with both losses coming in Prizefighter. 
The evening's other British title fight will be contested at super flyweight, where Birmingham's Kal Yafai meets Jason Cunningham for the vacant belt. 
Kal’s unbeaten younger brother Gamal Yafai undertakes another important assignment, with a final eliminator for the Commonwealth super bantamweight title against Nasibu Ramadhani. 
A 10-round bout for the WBC International belt could be a David versus Goliath task for Rowley Regis’ Jason Welborn, who goes up against three-time world title challenger Matthew Macklin. 
Midlands champion Welborn will be Brummie Macklin’s first fight in the light middleweight division for nearly 10 years, with the veteran dropping down at age 33. 
‘Mack the Knife’ has proved a puncher up at middleweight while Welborn, 29, has campaigned for most of his career at welterweight. 
Stafford’s Rob Hunt puts up the Midlands welterweight title for the first time elsewhere on the show, with Brummie Karl Wiggins getting his shot. 
Hunt pits his wits against an adversary six years his senior, but the 29-year-old has nearly four times more pro experience. 
Oldbury-based Brummie Craig Cunningham has been left high and dry, as his wait to defend the Midlands middleweight crown continues. 
Cunningham won the strap 10 months ago with Halesowen’s Lennox Clarke, who was ruled out through flu, due to be his first challenger. 
The solid southpaw remains on the card, though, as he keeps busy and his spirits up with a six-rounder against the never-stopped Yorkshireman Adam Jones. 
And it’s double trouble for Bloxwich’s Daniel Breeze, who steps through the ropes for the first time since learning he will become a father for the first time, to twins! 
The unbeaten teenage welterweight, 19, must put that one side against the experienced and capable Chris Jenkinson, who has eight wins on his pro record. 
Michael Rooney also tackles Liam Richards at light welter, while Cori Gibbs goes up against 'Fonz' Alexander Anderson at the same weight in a four-rounder. 
That distance also pairs Zach Parker with Bulgarian Samet Hyuseinov at middleweight, while Jordan Cooke and Chris Adaway lock horns at lightweight. 
Stay with us for blow-by-blow analysis from the first bell to the last tonight, with Craig Birch and Matchroom's Paul Ready at ringside for us. It's expected to start just after 5pm. Who wins what where and how? Make your predictions on the boxing tonight below.
